definition: lit. to beat the return drum (idiom)/fig. to give up/to turn tail
dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw

(main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell

sentences.english: We've signed an agreement and we can't back out of it now.
sentences.chinese: 我們已經簽訂了協議，現在可不能打退堂鼓。

sentences.english: Don't beat a retreat immediately after any setback, at least you should make another attempt to hit it.
sentences.chinese: 不要一遇到挫折就打退堂鼓，至少你應該再試一次。

sentences.english: We thought he had decided but then he pulled back.
sentences.chinese: 我們原以爲他已經決定，但後來他又打退堂鼓了。

sentences.english: It's too late to back down now.
sentences.chinese: 現在打退堂鼓已經太晚了。

sentences.english: Some of what we eat on a daily basis excretes back out via our pores.
sentences.chinese: 有的每天喫什麼，我們就通過我們的孔蜜打退堂鼓。

sentences.english: They promised to cut taxes, but they're beginning to backpedal now.
sentences.chinese: 他們答應要減稅，現在卻開始打退堂鼓。

definition: to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to shrink back/to cower
to meet with a rebuff
downhearted/downcast/in despair
(coll.) to quit one's job in disgust
to give up halfway (idiom); leave sth unfinished
to feel terrified/to grow apprehensive
to run away/to escape
to be discouraged
to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
if you ride a tiger, it's hard to get off (idiom); fig. impossible to stop halfway
when things come to a head (idiom)
to leave in stealth/to slip away
to fear/to feel terrified
hesitancy/indecision/to waver
lit. to fear the wolf in front and the tiger behind (idiom)/fig. to be full of needless fears/reds under the beds
pinyin: qian2 pa4 lang2 hou4 pa4 hu3
